channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Police Officer Surpasses $10K/Month FI Goal w/Out-of-State Sober Living Investments
item.description: Achieving your FI number in just four years? If you want to do it too, you must try something different. This couple found a niche within a niche, allowing them […]

item.title: Form3, a quiet giant in UK fintech, raises $60M at a $570M valuation
item.description: The global economy remains in a sticky spot, in the words of the International Monetary Fund, so banks and other financial players are looking to do what they can to bring down operating costs while spurring more financial activity. Today, Form3 — one of the startups building pipes to do just that by connecting financial […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: She Ate a Poppy Seed Salad Just Before Giving Birth. Then They Took Her Baby Away.
item.description: Hospitals use drug tests that return false positives from poppy seed bagels, decongestants and Zantac. Yet newborns are being taken from parents based on the results.

item.title: A 5-Year Plan for Financial Freedom With Real Estate (That Anyone Can Replicate)
item.description: There's no "fast track" to financial freedom, but with careful steps and a goal, it's certainly possible to do it in five years.

item.title: Threads is not working on its own DM system yet, but it might make it easier to send Instagram messages
item.description: The Threads team is not yet working on a separate inbox or a direct messaging system for the social network, despite user demands and will continue to use Instagram inbox. However, the company might make it easier to send messages to Instagram right from the Threads app. App researcher Adwaith Varma posted on Threads an unreleased Threads […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Seemingly Endless Cycle of Reforms in Juvenile Justice
item.description: As Ohio considers closing youth detention facilities, recent efforts in other states have hit roadblocks.

item.title: America’s Top Tech Hubs—and the Real Estate Growth It’s Driving
item.description: Redfin once published data that showed for every 1% increase in tech workers in their sample of cities, there was an average 0.49% increase in home prices. Granted, the article […]

item.title: Google loses appeal against EU’s $2.7B Shopping antitrust decision, as bloc also wins $15B Apple state aid appeal
item.description: Google has once again lost in its bid to overturn a 2017 antitrust decision by the European Commission. The bloc found its shopping comparison service had broken competition rules — hitting Alphabet, Google’s parent, with an at-the-time record-breaking €2.42 billion penalty (around $2.7 billion at current exchange rates) and ordering changes to how it operates […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: You’re About to Deliver Your Baby. This Faulty Drug Test Could Take Your Newborn Away.
item.description: Listen to our investigation into how hospitals use unreliable test results to report parents to child welfare agencies.

item.title: Trump vs. Harris Economic Plans: Taxes, Affordable Housing, and Inflation
item.description: How will the Trump and Harris economic plans affect your investing? One candidate is looking to increase affordable housing and give homebuyers a break on their first property. The other […]

item.title: Formo gets investors’ mouths watering with Koji protein-based animal-free cheese
item.description: A love of food — and, well, cheese — has landed German fermentation startup Formo‘s co-founder Roman Plewka and its team a hefty $61 million Series B round to keep scaling production of their climate-friendly, animal-free cheese. The Berlin-based startup’s first products use a base of Koji protein, a type of fungal microorganism that’s been […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Serious Case of Prison Visit Blues
item.description: Tariq MaQbool reflects on disruptive COVID-era visitation restrictions that remain in effect at New Jersey State Prison.

item.title: The “Creative” Framework for Low-Down, High-Return Rentals
item.description: Are high interest rates and large down payments stopping you from investing in real estate? If so, creative finance might be precisely what you need. It’s what today’s guest, Ankit […]

item.title: Swiggy weighs increasing its IPO size by $150M, aiming to raise up to $1.4B
item.description: Swiggy is considering boosting the fresh issue component of its IPO by $150 million, targeting a total of $1.4 billion. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Efforts to Cut Long Prison Sentences Have Stalled
item.description: Crime victim advocates and conservative groups are resisting moves to revisit “truth-in-sentencing” laws.
